TextBlock.Text: MELORAE: A new celestial object seems to have entered our little system, captured by the Sun's gravitational pull!
MELORAE: Unfortunately, there is a thick outer layer of strangely coloured ice on it, preventing further investigation. For now, we can only observe from its moon.
COLEUS: It would be possible to drill down, through this layer, to the object's interior.
FILIX: That would be reckless! We have no idea what's down there and to just drill down with no precaution would put us all in danger.
ANNONA: Actually, since it has just entered our system, there is a significant chance that the solar energy from our Sun may be enough to melt the ice, eventually.
COLEUS: So you suggest that we simply wait?
ANNONA: Well, why not? We'll be stuck here for a long time, after all.
